content.description: An established route that's been here for a bit. Fun route with lots of variations. cruxy start into a mixed bag of face, jug, and crack. Crux between bolt 3 - 4. Some hollow rock, but well protected.
content.location: Bolted route on right face, above flat rock.

content.description:
Fun route that protects well (cams, tricams, nuts). Thin crack widens past the start. Decent mix of feature and crack. Has an exit bolt for reaching anchors. #3 cam recommended if you choose to do a direct top out.

Check Wooden Tooth for route beta photo.
content.location: Look for exit bolt to the right of Wooden Tooth. The route is crack to the right of the exit bolt.

content.description:
Step up and into the crack. Follow for top. Optional Top out in widing offwidth -> chimney crack for those who like wide stuff.

A mix if jamming and face climbing with some fun hand / foot jams mixed in. Can be climbed as a fun pure crack climb or mix of crack and face. Bolts for wooden tooth are always nearby for the new leader in the grade.
content.protection: Shares anchors with wooden tooth,  standard rack, optional big gear, bolts 3-4 feet to left if needed
content.location: The first crack right of wooden tooth, left / second crack from the right / entrance

content.description:
Slightly overhung start moves into technical slab mix of crimps and slide pulls.

Jim Voss added anchors, will eventually be bolted for sport. Anchors can be reached either by walking up or leading the routes to the right to walk off.
content.location: Featured rock to the left. make sure you see the anchors from the ground before you head up.
